comments:
I noticed a few of these in my logs when I shutdown.  When the EventRedeliverer is closed, the eventAdminTracker is set to null, but there is a window where the null check is true and when you use it, it is now null.  It looks like the order in which listeners and trackers are dealt with in close() may affect this.

2006/06/08 15:49:11.328 SEVERE EclipseLog An unexpected runtime error has occurred. ::thread=Framework Event Dispatcher ::loggername=EclipseLog

	java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipsei.equinox.event.mapper.EventRedeliverer.getEventAdmin(EventRedeliverer.java:150)
	at org.eclipsei.equinox.event.mapper.EventRedeliverer.bundleChanged(EventRedeliverer.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.dispatchEvent(BundleContextImpl.java:1205)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager.dispatchEvent(EventManager.java:189)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager$EventThread.run(EventManager.java:291)
and for pete's sake, consider renaming that class!  EventCourier perhaps?
